title: Build /implement skill: claim issue, execute, close on completion
Build /explore skill: create issue, plan in --design field
Beads swarm + Claude teams integration
Phase 1: Implement skill rewrite
description:
1. Rewrite implement SKILL.md with actual Task spawning syntax using team_name param
2. Create worker prompt template with atomic claiming (bd update --claim)
3. Add epic context extraction (bd show epic --json → design field)
4. Wave 0 single-wave proof-of-concept (spawn N workers for ready tasks)

title: Phase 2: Wave orchestration
description:
1. Wave completion detection (teammate messages + bd swarm status --json verification)
2. Progressive wave spawning through full DAG (bd ready --parent for next wave)
3. Timeout-based stuck task detection (10 min default)
4. Team lifecycle: TeamCreate at start, TeamDelete when all waves done

title: Phase 3: Error handling
description:
1. Worker crash detection (compare spawned count vs completed messages)
2. File conflict detection and reporting in beads notes
3. Graceful degradation (continue with unblocked tasks if some fail)
4. --solo fallback mode for conflict-prone epics

title: Phase 4: Validation
description:
1. Test with multi-wave epic (e.g., 2-2-1 wave pattern)
2. Test worker failure scenarios
3. Update CLAUDE.md with swarm usage guidelines

title: Ensure bd lint passes on all bead creation paths
description:
All 6 bead-creating skills must produce lint-clean issues with
required markdown sections (## Acceptance Criteria, ## Steps to
Reproduce, ## Success Criteria) based on issue type.

## Success Criteria
- [ ] All skills that create beads include --description with required sections
- [ ] bd lint passes for beads created by every skill
- [ ] Each skill runs bd lint after creation and self-corrects on failure

title: Phase 1: Fix explore and review skills
description:
Update explore and review SKILL.md to include --description flags
with required markdown sections in their bd create commands.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] explore skill bd create includes --description with ## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] review skill bd create includes --description with ## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Beads created by both skills pass bd lint

title: Phase 2: Fix debug and start skills
description:
Update debug and start SKILL.md to include --description flags
with required markdown sections in their bd create commands.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] debug skill bd create includes --description with ## Steps to Reproduce and ## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] start skill bd create includes --description with ## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Beads created by both skills pass bd lint

title: Phase 3: Fix prepare skill
description:
Update prepare SKILL.md to include proper --description flags:
epic creation needs ## Success Criteria, task creation needs
## Acceptance Criteria formatted correctly.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] prepare epic bd create includes --description with ## Success Criteria
- [ ] prepare task bd create descriptions include ## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Beads created by prepare pass bd lint

title: Phase 4: Harden fix skill
description:
Ensure fix skill templates always include required section headings
(## Acceptance Criteria for task/feature, ## Steps to Reproduce +
## Acceptance Criteria for bugs).

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] fix skill bug template includes ## Steps to Reproduce and ## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] fix skill task/feature template includes ## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Beads created by fix skill pass bd lint

title: Phase 5: Add bd lint gate to all skills
description:
Add instruction to all bead-creating skills: after every bd create,
run bd lint on the new issue. If lint fails, update the description
to fix violations before proceeding.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] All 6 bead-creating skills include bd lint gate instruction
- [ ] Skills self-correct when bd lint fails
- [ ] Gate is documented in each SKILL.md

title: Explore: ensure bd lint passes on all bead creation paths
design:
## Current State: Bead Creation Across Skills

6 of 11 skills create beads. Only **fix** provides --description.

### Skills That Create Beads

| Skill | Type | Has --description | Lint Status |
|-------|------|-------------------|-------------|
| explore | task | NO | FAIL (missing ## Acceptance Criteria) |
| review | task | NO | FAIL (missing ## Acceptance Criteria) |
| fix | bug/task/feature | YES | PARTIAL (freeform, may lack headings) |
| debug | bug | NO | FAIL (missing ## Steps to Reproduce + ## Acceptance Criteria) |
| start | task | NO | FAIL (missing ## Acceptance Criteria) |
| prepare | epic + tasks | PARTIAL (tasks only) | FAIL (epic missing ## Success Criteria, tasks missing ## Acceptance Criteria) |

### What bd lint Requires

- **bug**: `## Steps to Reproduce` AND `## Acceptance Criteria`
- **task**: `## Acceptance Criteria`
- **feature**: `## Acceptance Criteria`
- **epic**: `## Success Criteria`
- **chore**: no requirements

### Recommendation

Update each skill SKILL.md to include proper --description flags
with required markdown sections inline in the bd create commands.
No shared library needed — just fix the templates in each skill.

### Next Steps

**Phase 1: Fix explore and review skills**
1. Add --description with ## Acceptance Criteria to explore bd create
2. Add --description with ## Acceptance Criteria to review bd create

**Phase 2: Fix debug and start skills**
3. Add --description with ## Steps to Reproduce + ## Acceptance Criteria to debug bd create
4. Add --description with ## Acceptance Criteria to start bd create

**Phase 3: Fix prepare skill**
5. Add --description with ## Success Criteria to epic bd create
6. Reformat task bd create descriptions to include ## Acceptance Criteria

**Phase 4: Harden fix skill**
7. Ensure fix skill templates always include required section headings

**Phase 5: Add bd lint gate**
8. Add instruction to all bead-creating skills: run bd lint after creation, fix if fails

title: Remaining Gaps in Beads-Native Skill Set
Phase 1: Debug Workflow
description:
1. Create /debug skill for CI failures, failing tests, bugs
2. Integrates with beads (creates/closes bug issues)
3. Works on current branch or specific beads issue

title: Phase 2: Graphite Wrapper
description:
4. Create /gt skill for common Graphite operations
5. Supports: log, restack, sync, info, amend
6. Maintains beads sync on state-changing operations

title: Phase 3: Resume PR Work
description:
7. Create /resume-work skill (avoids collision with built-in /resume)
8. Primary use case: returning to a PR after a break
9. Shows: PR status, CI check results, unresolved review comments, in_progress beads for current branch
10. Suggests next action: fix CI, address comments, continue implementation

title: Phase 4: Fix Workflow
description:
11. Create /fix skill for post-implementation feedback
12. User provides feedback on recent implementation
13. Skill creates beads issues from the feedback (one per finding)
14. Output: list of new beads ready for /prepare → /implement
15. Does NOT implement fixes itself — just structures feedback into actionable beads

title: Review Skill Redesign: Match Explore Workflow
Phase 1: Rewrite Core Review Skill
description:
1. Rewrite SKILL.md to match explore pattern
2. Create review bead: bd create "Review: {branch}"
3. Set in_progress, store findings in design field (not notes)
4. Leave bead open
5. Structure findings as phases for /prepare compatibility
6. Output suggests bd edit <id> --design and /prepare

title: Phase 2: Task Delegation
description:
7. Replace direct review with Task subagent spawn
8. Create review prompt template (file diffs + context)
9. Subagent returns phase-structured findings
10. Orchestrator stores in design field

title: Phase 3: Team Support for Large Reviews
description:
11. Detect large reviews (>15 files changed)
12. Split files across parallel Review subagents
13. Aggregate findings into consolidated design
14. TeamCreate/TeamDelete lifecycle

title: Phase 4: /prepare Integration
description:
15. Test /prepare with review-structured design (likely works as-is)
16. If needed: add type inference (phase "Critical Bugs" → type=bug)
17. If needed: add priority mapping (Critical → P0/P1)

title: Phase 5: End-to-End Testing
description:
18. Test /review on small branch (<10 files)
19. Test /review on large branch (>20 files, team mode)
20. Test full pipeline: /review → edit → /prepare → /implement

title: Swarm: Remaining Gaps in Beads-Native Skill Set
description:
Swarm molecule orchestrating epic claude-5jp.

Epic: claude-5jp
Coordinator:

title: Explore: Review skill redesign to match explore workflow
design:
# Review Skill Redesign: Match Explore Workflow

## Current State

### `/review` (current)
- Direct implementation, no Task delegation
- Creates multiple finding beads immediately per finding
- Creates summary bead, stores in `notes` field
- Closes everything — no follow-up workflow
- No team support for large reviews

### `/explore` (the pattern to follow)
- Creates bead → delegates to Task subagent → stores in `design` field
- Leaves issue open for continuation
- Supports `--continue` to resume
- User reviews findings, then `/prepare` converts to tasks

### `/prepare`
- Reads `design` field, parses `**Phase N:**` markers
- Creates epic + child tasks with dependencies
- Validates swarm, creates swarm molecule
- Suggests `/implement <epic-id>`

### `/implement`
- Detects epic vs task
- Epic: spawns Claude team, wave-based parallel execution
- Task: single subagent
- Workers claim atomically, implement, close

## Recommendation

**Mirror explore pattern for review:**
1. Create review bead → delegate to subagent(s) → store in `design`
2. Leave open for user to review/edit findings
3. Use `/prepare` to convert findings to epic + tasks
4. Use `/implement` to execute

**Extend `/prepare`** rather than new skill. Review findings
just need phase structure (Critical Bugs, Code Quality, Testing
Gaps as phases). /prepare already handles this.

**Team support**: Spawn team for large reviews (>15 changed files),
split files across parallel subagents, aggregate findings.

## Next Steps

**Phase 1: Rewrite Core Review Skill**
1. Rewrite SKILL.md to match explore pattern
2. Create review bead: `bd create "Review: {branch}"`
3. Set in_progress, store findings in `design` field (not notes)
4. Leave bead open
5. Structure findings as phases for /prepare compatibility
6. Output suggests `bd edit <id> --design` and `/prepare`

**Phase 2: Task Delegation**
7. Replace direct review with Task subagent spawn
8. Create review prompt template (file diffs + context)
9. Subagent returns phase-structured findings
10. Orchestrator stores in design field

**Phase 3: Team Support for Large Reviews**
11. Detect large reviews (>15 files changed)
12. Split files across parallel Review subagents
13. Aggregate findings into consolidated design
14. TeamCreate/TeamDelete lifecycle

**Phase 4: /prepare Integration**
15. Test /prepare with review-structured design (likely works as-is)
16. If needed: add type inference (phase "Critical Bugs" → type=bug)
17. If needed: add priority mapping (Critical → P0/P1)

**Phase 5: End-to-End Testing**
18. Test /review on small branch (<10 files)
19. Test /review on large branch (>20 files, team mode)
20. Test full pipeline: /review → edit → /prepare → /implement

title: Explore: eliminate .jim/ in favor of beads-native workflow
design:
# Eliminate .jim/ in Favor of Beads-Native Workflow

## Core Idea
Store all exploration plans, review notes, and state in beads
fields (design, notes, acceptance_criteria) instead of .jim/ files.

## Current .jim/ Usage (4 skills affected)
- **explore**: writes to .jim/plans/<topic>.md
- **prepare**: reads from .jim/plans/*.md
- **review**: writes to .jim/notes/review-*.md
- **implement**: references .jim/plans/ for context

7 skills have zero .jim/ dependency already.

## Beads Field Mapping
| Current | Beads Field |
|---------|-------------|
| .jim/plans/<topic>.md | design field |
| .jim/notes/review-*.md | notes field |
| .jim/states/active-*.md | status=in_progress |

TEXT fields have no practical size limit (SQLite: 1GB).
Largest plan seen: 20KB. Safety margin: 59,880x.

## Proposed Workflow
1. /explore creates beads issue, stores findings in design field
2. User reviews via `bd edit <id> --design`
3. User continues via `/explore --continue` or `/explore <id>`
4. /prepare reads design field, creates child tasks, closes issue
5. No .jim/ needed

## Phases

**Phase 1: Explore Skill Migration**
1. Update explore to write findings to beads design field
2. Remove .jim/plans/ writes
3. Support --continue and issue ID args

**Phase 2: Prepare Skill Migration**
1. Read plan from beads design field instead of .jim/plans/
2. Accept beads issue ID as input

**Phase 3: Review + Implement Updates**
1. Review stores findings in beads notes field
2. Implement reads context from beads design field

**Phase 4: CLAUDE.md + Cleanup**
1. Remove .jim/ documentation from global CLAUDE.md
2. Add beads field usage guidelines
3. Keep .jim/archive/ as read-only legacy (67 historical files)

## Risks
- bd edit less convenient than direct file editing
- JSONL diffs harder to review than markdown
- Archive migration (punt: keep read-only)

## Recommendation
Proceed with 4-phase migration. Start with explore+prepare
(highest value), then review+implement, then docs cleanup.
Keep .jim/archive/ read-only indefinitely.

title: Explore: beads swarm + claude teams integration for parallel agents
design:
# Beads Swarm + Claude Teams Integration

## Core Idea
Wire beads swarm waves directly to Claude Code TeamCreate/Task
for true parallel agent execution. Team lead orchestrates waves,
workers are ephemeral per-task agents.

## Architecture
- Team lead = implement skill
- Workers = Task agents spawned with team_name param
- Beads = source of truth for task state
- Claude teams = execution layer only

## Worker Lifecycle
Spawn → bd update <id> --claim → read context → implement →
bd close <id> → SendMessage to lead → shutdown

## Wave Orchestration
1. bd swarm validate <epic> --json → extract wave 0 IDs
2. Spawn N workers (one per ready task)
3. Wait for all completion messages
4. Verify with bd swarm status --json
5. bd ready --parent <epic> → next wave
6. Repeat until empty
7. bd epic close-eligible → TeamDelete

## Key Design Decisions
- Atomic claiming via bd update --claim (prevents races)
- Ephemeral workers (fresh per task, no reuse across waves)
- File conflict mitigation via task description file ownership
- Timeout detection for crashed workers (10 min default)
- --solo fallback when file overlap unavoidable

## Phases

**Phase 1: Implement Skill Rewrite**
1. Actual Task spawning syntax with team_name param
2. Worker prompt template with atomic claiming
3. Wave 0 single-wave proof-of-concept

**Phase 2: Wave Orchestration**
4. Wave completion detection (messages + bd swarm status)
5. Progressive wave spawning through full DAG
6. Timeout-based stuck task detection

**Phase 3: Error Handling**
7. Worker crash detection (spawned vs completed count)
8. File conflict reporting
9. Graceful degradation (continue unblocked tasks on failure)

**Phase 4: Validation**
10. Test with multi-wave epic
11. Test failure scenarios
12. Update docs

title: Build /review skill: code review, file bugs as beads

Phase 1: Explore skill migration
description:
1. Update explore skill to write findings to beads design field via bd update <id> --design
2. Remove .jim/plans/ write operations from explore skill
3. Support --continue flag and issue ID args for resuming explorations
4. Task agent writes to tmpfile, then stores via bd update <id> --design @<tmpfile>

title: Phase 2: Prepare skill migration
description:
1. Update prepare skill to read plan from beads design field instead of .jim/plans/
2. Accept beads issue ID as input (bd show <id> --json to extract design)
3. Fall back to .jim/plans/ for backward compatibility during transition

title: Phase 3: Review + implement skill updates
description:
1. Update review skill to store findings in beads notes field instead of .jim/notes/
2. Update implement skill to read context from beads design field instead of .jim/plans/
3. Remove all .jim/ write paths from both skills

title: Phase 4: CLAUDE.md + cleanup
description:
1. Remove .jim/ documentation section from global CLAUDE.md
2. Add beads field usage guidelines (design for plans, notes for reviews)
3. Keep .jim/archive/ as read-only legacy (67 historical files)
4. Validate full workflow: explore → prepare → implement → review → commit
